Setting permissions from the related object
Setting permissions from the related object is the differentiation of access to instances of the current object type, taking into account the permissions of the parent object (for more information about setting permissions, refer to:
Setting permissions for an object type
).
Let’s consider setting permissions from the related object.
You need to make an
Application for decision-making
for the
New guarantee
.
Accordingly, you need to create such object types as:
Application for decision-making
,
New guarantee
.
After creating the object type
Application for decision-making
(including child attributes with references to
New guarantee
) with the necessary access to object instances (for more information, refer to:
Setting permissions for an object type
), the remaining object types are implemented.
At the same time, when creating new object types (
New guarantee
), to simplify permission setting to their instances, you need to select the following values in the fields of the object type profile [Administration→ Object register→ open the profile of the object type selected] (to take into account the permissions of the object type
Application for decision-making
):
in the Permissions control type field: the value
Inherit permissions from the related object
(for more information about setting permissions, refer to:
General procedure for setting permissions
);
in the Attribute to inherit permissions field: previously configured attribute
Relation to the Application for decision-making
.
Setting up the
New guarantee
object type
Accordingly, the permissions to instances of the
New guarantee
object types are similar to those for the ''Application for decision-making".
In this case, the System borrows permissions not to the object type, but to a separate instance.
